Title: Practical PCG Through Large Language Models
Abstract: large language models  large language model  have proven to be useful tools in various domains outside of the field of their inception which was natural language processing. in this study we provide practical directions on how to use large language model to generate 2d game rooms for an under development game named metavoidal. our technique can harness the power of gpt-3 by human in the loop fine tuning which allows our method to create 37% playable novel levels from as scarce data as only 60 hand designed rooms under a scenario of the non trivial game with respect to  procedural content generation  pcg that has a good amount of local and global constraints.
